Initially, be in tabletop position. Inhale, move your belly towards the floor, lift your chin up in the cow pose. Now, exhale by moving your back and belly upwards towards the ceiling in the cat pose. Repeat it.
Lie down with your face, towards the ground and hands on your side. Now, with the support of your hands, lift the body and move to the table top position. Exhale and lift your hip towards the sky.
Lie down with your face, towards the ground and hands stretched forward. Lift your right arm and left leg above the ground. Be in this position. Repeat the same on the other side.
Sit down on the floor with your legs forward . Now stretch your arms forward. Then return back to the initial position.
Keep your hands on the back of your head. Now bend forward. Then return back to the initial position.
Initially, hang on a pole. Now raise both your legs. Then return back to the initial position.
Initially rest on one leg. Then hop as high as you can, around 10 to 15 times. Repeat it on the other side.
Lie on your back with your legs tilted and arms by the side. Now raise your hips and be in this position for some time. Then lower your hips.

Lie on your back with your arms by the side. Now raise your legs together at 90 degree angle. Then exhale, lower your body to a horizontal position and further. Caution : While lowering your body, do not try to stretch beyond your limits. If you feel any discomfort or pain, immediately consult a doctor.
Be on your toes and forearms with your body straight. Stay in this position for as long as possible.
Rope jumping is skipping. For this you need a skipping rope. Do it in sets of 15 as a beginner. Gradually increase the count.
Sit with your legs stretched forward. Now raise your legs and stretch your body with your arms forward, then touch the knee and if possible the shin and toe.
Initially, stand on your feet. Now raise your arms straight and upwards, then start jumping. Repeat it for 2 minutes.

Stand with your feet wider than your hips. Inhale, stretch your arms over your head and lock your hands. Now inhale and lean towards the left, then exhale and return back to the initial position. Repeat the same on the other side.

Initially, keep your arms perpendicular to the ground and your spine arched. Bend your hips and bring the body to a V shaped position. Be in this position for sometime and then return back to the initial position.

Sit with your legs stretched forward with hands on the side and palms touching the ground. Now lift your body by pressing the arms and feet on the ground to make a table like shape. Stay in this position for about 15 seconds and then return back to the initial position. Repeat it.

Stretch your legs, a little more than the shoulder width. Turn your right toe to the side. Inhale and raise your arms to the side. Exhale and stretch your right hand to touch the shin by tilting your hip, the left hand should be pointing towards the sky. Take two to three long, slow breaths through your nose. Inhale and come back to the initial position. Repeat the same on the other side.

Lie on your back with your hands by the side. Raise your legs above the ground at 90 degree. Now with the support of your forearms, lift your body and legs further up towards the ceiling, with the hands placed at the back for support.
Lean against a wall with your hands. Now stretch with your left leg, a feet away from the wall and your right leg, a feet away from your left leg. Repeat on the other side.

Extra Long Height. Practice Yoga Asanas and take enough rest and sleep well. Eat at the right time. Be more confident. Improve your posture. Maintain your balanced food and add more fresh fruits and leafy vegetables

Avoid injuries. Carefully follow the instructions, for each of the workouts, to prevent injuries.
Get adequate sleep of around 7 -8 hours. Insufficient sleep can lead to heart diseases, high blood pressure, diabetes, obesity etc.
For your workout, buy shoes that are comfortable. It is better to go for training shoes, as it will give you the comfort and the grip that you are looking for. Replace shoes once in six months.
Exercise in the morning. Exercising in the morning promotes weight loss, prevents diabetes, lowers blood pressure, keeps you active throughout the day and has many more benefits.
Have a complete breakfast. Let the breakfast be the heaviest meal in the day. After a good night sleep, you need a nutritious breakfast to kick start your day.
Drink sufficient quantity of water. Men should consume about 3.7 liters of water per day and women should consume about 2.7 liters of water per day.
Always make sure, you have a rest day in between your workout days. Let every fourth day be a rest day. Taking rest will help your muscles to grow.
Avoid junk food as it is high in calories. Junk food can cause obesity, heart diseases and other health conditions.
Eat a healthy diet. Consume protein rich and low calorie food, as it gives you sufficient strength during workouts and builds muscles.
Increase your fiber intake. Fiber intake aids digestion and also helps to lose weight and improves your heart health. Consume fiber rich food like beans, broccoli, oatmeal etc.
Please provide a new number of steps you walked.
The app counts your steps in background.
On some devices the processor falls asleep and prevents counting steps. Enable this to keep the processor awake while counting steps - this may drain your battery!
For better results during training mode keep processor awake. If app should keep the processor awake at any time this is automatically the case.
The app shows your current velocity in daily report. Access to your location is required to calculate the exact velocity.
To improve the calculation of the calories please set your weight and gender.
The permanent notification is shown when the app counts your steps in background. You can customize what the app should show you.
The app uses the accelerometer of your device. To optimize the step detection adjust the sensitivity, please.
Show number of steps walked today

string-array.name: pref_keys_notification_motivation_alert_criterion
string-array.item: less than 90％ of daily step goal
less than 70％ of daily step goal
less than 50％ of daily step goal

resources.string: Privacy Friendly Pedometer can count your steps in background and provides an overview about walked steps.
To improve the calculation of the calories you have burned by walking please customize your personal settings.
You can switch your current walking modes using the context menu in the toolbar.
Add a widget to your homescreen to stay up to date about your walked steps.

string-array.name: pref_default_notification_motivation_alert_messages
string-array.item: Come on, it\'s time to walk!

resources.string: Set custom alert messages when the achievement of your daily step goal is in danger.\n\nThere will be no alert if no message exists.
Set your own custom motivation alert. The app notifies you with one of your texts randomly.
Empty motivation alerts are useless, aren\'t they?
At least one walking mode is required.
Cannot delete an active walking mode.
The application can learn the distance per step. Please walk the given distance and press end if you finished.
Name and step length are required. Please fill in!
It seems like you didn\'t used the training functionality, yet. It\'s time to start your training!

The app detects your steps based on different algorithms. On some devices you can define the sensivity of step detection in settings. In addition to that you can add steps you walked without the app or correct the stepcount on daily activity chart.
Define custom walking modes and notifications if the achievement of your daily step goal is in danger.
In the settings you can define your own walking modes with different step lengths.
You can define your own walking modes like \'Running\' or \'Walking\' in the preferences. Each walking mode has its own step length.
The training sessions can be used to track your training performance. Each session tracks e.g. the training duration, the walked steps and distance.

The distance measurement feature allows you to measure the distance between the button press \'Start\' and \'Stop\'. The data will not be stored after app restarts. To persist the data you can use the training sessions.
You can modify the detected daily steps in daily report view. This allows you to add steps you walked without the app or to correct the detected number of steps.
Click on \'Preferences\' to set your step size and customize your personal data.
